name: MQM Standard
description: Standard MQM model with categories and subcategories limited to two levels. Based on MQM Core (WMT 2020).

severities.label: Minor
severities.description: An issue that slightly affects quality but does not change meaning or seriously reduce usability.

severities.label: Major
severities.description: An issue that significantly affects meaning, usability, or professional presentation.

severities.label: Critical
severities.description: An issue that renders the translation incorrect or unusable, such as a meaning inversion or offensive content.

errorCategories.label: Accuracy
errorCategories.description: Errors where the target text does not accurately represent the meaning of the source text.

subcategories.label: Mistranslation
subcategories.description: The translated content conveys an incorrect meaning, changes intent, or mistranslates key terms or expressions.

subcategories.label: Addition
subcategories.description: Information has been added in the translation that is not present in the source text.

subcategories.label: Omission
subcategories.description: Content or meaning present in the source text is missing from the translation.

subcategories.label: Untranslated Text
subcategories.description: Portions of the text remain in the source language or are otherwise left untranslated.

errorCategories.label: Fluency
errorCategories.description: Errors related to the form or naturalness of the target text, independent of source meaning.

subcategories.label: Grammar
subcategories.description: Incorrect grammar, including agreement, tense, or word form errors.

subcategories.label: Spelling
subcategories.description: Misspelled words, typos, or incorrect diacritics.

subcategories.label: Punctuation
subcategories.description: Improper punctuation use or omission affecting readability or correctness.

subcategories.label: Word Order
subcategories.description: Unnatural or incorrect word order that reduces fluency or clarity.

subcategories.label: Register
subcategories.description: Incorrect level of formality, tone, or style for the intended audience.

errorCategories.label: Terminology
errorCategories.description: Errors involving inconsistent or incorrect use of specialized terms or glossary entries.

subcategories.label: Inconsistent Terminology
subcategories.description: The same term is translated differently within the same document or project.

subcategories.label: Incorrect Terminology
subcategories.description: A specialized term is translated incorrectly or conflicts with approved terminology.

errorCategories.label: Style
errorCategories.description: Errors where the translation fails to follow stylistic guidelines or target-language conventions.

subcategories.label: Awkward or Non-Native Style
subcategories.description: Text is grammatically correct but unnatural or clumsy in the target language.

subcategories.label: Inconsistent Tone
subcategories.description: Inconsistent tone or style within the text or compared to previous translations.

subcategories.label: Inappropriate Style
subcategories.description: Tone or style does not fit the purpose, audience, or brand guidelines.

errorCategories.label: Locale Convention
errorCategories.description: Errors where the translation does not follow target locale norms or conventions.

subcategories.label: Date/Time Format
subcategories.description: Incorrect formatting of dates or times for the target locale.

subcategories.label: Number Format
subcategories.description: Incorrect use of separators, currency, or decimal conventions.

subcategories.label: Measurement Conversion
subcategories.description: Incorrect or missing conversion of measurement units.

errorCategories.label: Other
errorCategories.description: Errors that do not fit in any of the other defined categories.

subcategories.label: Uncategorized
subcategories.description: Used when the issue type does not match any other category.
